etymologies: Middle English: from Old French gerfaucon, of Germanic origin. The first element is probably related to Old High German gēr ‘spear’; the spelling gyr- arose from a mistaken idea that the bird's name came from Latin gyrare ‘revolve’

definitions: the largest falcon, found in arctic regions and occurring in several color forms, one of which is mainly white.
shortDefinitions: largest falcon, found in arctic regions and occurring in several colour forms, one
